titleStmt.title: J. H. Robbins to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2160

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p: Hon. Thos. E. Bramlett -- Mayfield Graves Co. Ky.

Sir encloseded please find the risingation of E. Charlton a Justice of the Peace in district No. 1. no one as yet has been nominated to fill the vacancy -- Some time since I forwarded you the resignation of J. M. Thomas a Justice of the Peace in District No. 6 and nominated W. L. Haynes to fill the vacancy. No commission having as yet come to hand I am strongly urged by parties concerned to call your attention to that matter again and respectfully to ask you to make the appointment, to wit, W. L. Haynes

Govr permit me in closing this note To express to you my sincere thanks & lasting obligations for your very prompt, pointed, & timely answer to my letter touching the validity of our Clerk's Election. It came just in the nich of time to entirely upset the arrangements of the Anti party, to thurst me out of the Office. The Result is I have the appointment from the Judge

Your most Obedt.
J. H. Robbins

Graves Co
Justice Peace
Resigantion & Appointment
31 Aug/65
